keyFactors.title: Embiid OUT
keyFactors.description: MVP candidate out with knee injury - massive edge

keyFactors.title: H2H Dominance
keyFactors.description: Heat own this matchup - 7-1 ATS in last 8 meetings

keyFactors.title: Road Warriors
keyFactors.description: Miami plays well on the road this season

quarterBreakdown.description: Heat jumped out to early lead
Miami maintained control, led at half
76ers made a push but Heat held firm

gameResults.turningPoint: Heat's ability to exploit 76ers' lack of interior presence

whatWentRight.title: Embiid Absence Exploited
whatWentRight.description: Heat attacked the paint at will without Embiid protecting rim

whatWentRight.title: Jimmy Butler Game
whatWentRight.description: Butler had 30 points, led the way

whatWentRight.title: Wire-to-Wire Win
whatWentRight.description: Controlled game from start to finish

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Perfect execution. Injury edge was massive - 76ers simply couldn't compete without Embiid.

closingLineValue.verdict: Good CLV - got better price than closing line

keyTakeaways: Injury edges are reliable - Embiid OUT was key
H2H history matters - Heat dominate this matchup
Line moved against us but still found value
verdict: Clean win. Embiid OUT was the edge. Heat dominated 127-117. Butler with 30. Exactly as expected.
